intro: Cischweinfia pusilla var. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf cischweinfia, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It features small, glossy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green color. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is a popular choice for gardens and indoor cultivation.
